iti108:0.3: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
iti108:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti108:2.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: those mendicants are no followers of mine.
iti108:2.2: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
iti108:2.3: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: those mendicants are followers of mine.
iti108:2.4: They haven’t left this teaching and training, and they do achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
iti108:2.5: That is what the Buddha said.
iti108:3.1: “Those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, and frauds,
iti108:3.3: these don’t grow in the teaching
iti108:3.4: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.
iti108:4.1: But those who are genuine, not flatterers, wise,
iti108:4.3: these do grow in the teaching
iti108:4.4: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.”
iti108:5.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
